summary: This is a brief email exchange from June 27, 2019, discussing a failed callback and proposing a meeting between the sender's and recipient's 'Epstein teams' to discuss operational plans.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein teams meeting
events.description: An email exchange where the sender notes a contact never called back and proposes setting up a meeting between their respective 'Epstein teams' to discuss operational plans.

keyFacts: The email is dated June 27, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
The correspondence references 'Epstein teams', indicating organized groups working on matters related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The purpose of the proposed meeting is to discuss 'op plans', likely referring to operational plans.
The document shows communication and planning among parties involved in the Epstein case post-arrest.
The tone is informal, sent from a mobile device ('Sent from my iPhone').
